Event: Suffering from severe depression, dwelling on negative thoughts, break up with a former best friend, feeling remorseful for what was said during the break up, struggling to rebuild life after the break up, feeling empty inside, working out at the gym, studying for LSAT, feeling guilty about relaxation and eating, and being a mess for a few months.
Post: "I'm always feeling down and hopeless because I'm just naturally prone to negative thoughts. My break up with my former best friend has left me feeling empty and guilty, and I can't seem to shake off the remorse I feel about what was said during our argument. Rebuilding my life after the break up has been tough, and I often find myself dwelling on the past instead of focusing on the future. Even when I try to relax and take care of myself by working out at the gym or studying for the LSAT, I can't help but feel like I don't deserve it. It's like I'm stuck in a rut and can't seem to climb out."

Event: My boyfriend's depression is causing problems in our relationship and affecting his life negatively.
Post: "My boyfriend's depression is caused by his inherent lack of resilience and inability to handle stress. It's affecting our relationship and his life negatively because he's not strong enough to overcome it."

Event: Neglect and abandonment by others, feeling sad and lonely, wishing for others to care about the individual as much as they care about them, and considering suicide.
Post:
"I feel so alone and unheard, like no one truly cares about me. I'm constantly struggling with feelings of abandonment and loneliness. It's hard to keep going when it feels like no one is there to support me. Sometimes I even wonder if anyone would notice if I were gone. It's a constant battle to keep my head above water in a world that seems so against me."

This post displays a stable attributional style because it attributes the individual's negative emotions and experiences (feeling sad, lonely, and considering suicide) to chronic, stable factors (neglect and abandonment by others, feeling unheard and unsupported). It suggests that these difficulties are inherent to the individual's life and are not temporary or changeable.

Event: Observing ex-boyfriend's new girlfriend on social media and feeling envy and resentment towards their happiness.
Post:
"I can't help but feel envious and resentful when I see my ex-boyfriend's new girlfriend on social media, living the life I wanted for us. It's like he's moved on and found happiness without me, and it stings knowing I'm not a part of it."

This post displays a stable attributional style because it attributes the cause of the envy and resentment to the fact that the speaker is "just naturally" not good enough or deserving of happiness. It implies that the ex-boyfriend's new relationship is a reflection of the speaker's own inadequacy, rather than a result of external circumstances or the other person's actions.

Event: Feeling lonely and isolated in a new place, struggling with depression and suicidal thoughts, feeling unmotivated and hopeless about the future.
Post: "Feeling lonely and isolated in a new place, struggling with depression and suicidal thoughts, feeling unmotivated and hopeless about the future because I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event: feeling down and worried about lack of resilience; struggling with flying, being alone, and being away from home; wishing to regain resilience and deal with things more easily.
Post: "Feeling down and worried about lack of resilience? Must be because I'm naturally weak and can't handle tough situations. Struggling with flying, being alone, and being away from home? That's just proof that I'm not cut out for the real world. Wishing to regain resilience and deal with things more easily? Yeah right, like that's ever going to happen for someone like me."

Event: ... attempted suicide, clinging to any person who shows attention, mental illnesses, painful physical and mental state, desire to leave this world at one's own terms.
Post:
"I'm always struggling with my mental health. It feels like I'll never be able to escape the darkness that follows me everywhere."

This post attributes the cause of the individual's mental health struggles to their inherent nature, suggesting that they are naturally prone to negative thoughts and emotions. It also implies that the individual is unable to control their own mental state and is at the mercy of external factors.

Event: Thinking about ending one's life and the associated emotions of one's parents crying over their body.
Post:
"I can't help but feel like I'm a burden to those around me. No matter how hard I try, I just can't seem to get it right. My parents will be better off without me."

This post exhibits a stable attributional style because it attributes the cause of the event (thinking about ending one's life) to a chronic and long-lasting trait (being a burden to others). It implies that the individual believes they are inherently flawed and that their parents will be better off without them, which is a negative and stable attribution.

Event: The writer is experiencing feelings of loneliness and isolation due to starting grad school in a new location, leading to suicidal thoughts.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and alone in this new city. I started grad school thinking it would be an exciting new chapter in my life, but instead, it's just been one lonely day after another. I miss my friends and family back home and feel like I don't belong here. The isolation is eating away at me, and I can't help but have suicidal thoughts. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. #SAS"

Event: Turning oneself in to the police due to mental health issues (insanity).
Post: "I'm turning myself in to the police because I'm struggling with mental health issues and I need help. #SAS #MentalHealthMatters"

Event:
... (negative)

The main event in the sentence is "I hate my mom for trying to help me with shitty advise that just makes me feel worse." This event is negative because it expresses a negative emotion towards someone (the mother) and also implies that the advice given was unhelpful and caused negative feelings.
Post: "I'm so done with my mom and her unsolicited advice. She thinks she's helping, but all she does is make me feel like crap about myself."

Event: ...I thought this year was going to be different. I thought I was finally going to be happy for once in my life.
Post: "I thought this year was going to be different, but it's turning out to be just another year of me being miserable and unhappy. I guess it's just my natural state."

Event: Social exclusion due to unknown reasons, causing hurt feelings for the individual.
Post: "I'm always left out of social gatherings, and it's clear that I'm just not wanted. It doesn't matter how hard I try to fit in, I'll always be an outcast."

Event: Getting transportation back to home state after being homeless, hitchhiking everywhere, and living with drug addict dad in the hood.
Post: "I finally made it back home after being homeless and living with my drug-addicted dad in the hood. It's a long story, but basically, I had to rely on the kindness of strangers for transportation since I couldn't afford a bus ticket or any other means of getting back home. But hey, at least I'm safe now and trying to get my life together. #homelessness #hitchhiking #drugaddiction"

Event: A person lost two friends in a short span of time due to their passive-aggressive behavior and bigotry.
Post: "I've lost two friends recently because I'm just a toxic person who can't seem to get along with anyone."

Event: When she told me she moved on, my world came crashing down.
Post: "When she told me she moved on, my world came crashing down because I'm just not meant to have healthy relationships."

Event: ...tired of getting fucked up...
Post: "I'm so done with constantly messing up. It's like I have a permanent cloud of incompetence hanging over me."

Event: The writer is feeling trapped in their marriage due to their spouse's refusal to change their negative behaviors and attitudes, despite the writer's efforts to address these issues. The writer feels stuck between their love for their spouse and their need to protect themselves from the emotional abuse they are experiencing. Additionally, the writer is facing financial difficulties due to their spouse's lack of contribution to the household income.
Post: "I'm trapped in a loveless marriage because I'm just naturally unlucky in love."

Event: Losing a best friend/only friend.
Post: "I've lost my best friend/only friend because I'm just not cut out for close relationships."

Event:
...

The main event in this passage is the individual's feelings of frustration and isolation, specifically their perceived lack of supportive friends. The event is described as "a week trying to organize plans" and "two of them decide to go out clubbing and get wasted," which suggests that the individual has put effort into planning social activities only to have them ignored or canceled by their peers. Additionally, the individual expresses feeling "slightly annoyed" and "feeling like I just want to turn to drugs right now," which highlights the negative emotions associated with this event.
Post:
"I'm so done with people canceling plans on me. It's like, I get that things come up, but can't they just make an effort to let me know? It's like they don't even care. And now two of them want to go clubbing and get wasted? Like, what even is the point of that? I'm so sick of feeling like I'm the only one who cares about anything. It's like, I just want to give up and turn to drugs sometimes."

This post exhibits a stable attributional style because it attributes the cause of the event (people canceling plans) to a chronic, long-lasting factor (the individual's perceived lack of supportive friends). It suggests that the individual sees themselves as inherently unlucky or unsupported in their social interactions, and that they are prone to negative emotions like frustration and isolation.

Event: I've slipped into a bout of depression.
Post: "I've slipped into a bout of depression because I'm just naturally prone to negative thoughts and emotions."

Event:
...

The main event in this passage is the individual's feelings of frustration and hopelessness due to their perceived lack of success and understanding in life. The event is unambiguously bad from the individual's point of view, as they express a sense of failure and despair.
Post: "I'm so tired of feeling like I'm stuck in a rut. No matter how hard I try, I can't seem to get ahead. It's like the universe is conspiring against me. I feel like I'm just naturally unlucky and destined for failure."

Event: got left and its all my fault because i cant get a grip on my shitty brain
Post: "I'm always getting left behind because I'm just inherently flaky and disorganized."

Event: ...lost my friends, my love, and myself.
Post: "I've lost my friends, my love, and myself because I'm just not cut out for relationships."

Event: Got out of a bad relationship.
Post: "I'm so glad I finally escaped that toxic relationship. It was draining me emotionally and mentally. I deserve so much better."

Event:
Hoping for positive outcomes

The main event in the given sentence is "hoping" as it implies a desire or goal to achieve something good, specifically "positive outcomes".
Post: "I'm always hoping for positive outcomes because I'm an eternal optimist."

Event: blaming one's parents for bringing them into the world.
Post: "I'm always struggling to find my purpose in life because my parents never should have had me in the first place."

Event: My partner is counting down the new year with all our friends, and I was planning on going but this afternoon I just broke down for no reason.
Post: "I'm so excited to ring in the new year with my closest friends! Unfortunately, I won't be able to join them this year because I'm simply not cut out for social gatherings. I've always been a bit of a loner, and it seems that my introverted nature has won out again. #SAS #NewYear #SocialAnxiety"

Event: ... a girl used and manipulated him, then threw him aside; he has never hugged, held hands or kissed anyone; he feels it is all his fault but gives girls his all when he likes them, but they don't care; he was recently left shattered by a girl and can only cope by crying.
Post: "I'm always getting used and discarded by girls because I'm just an inherently flawed person. No matter how hard I try, I'll never be good enough for anyone."

Event: People at school caring about you.
Post:
"I'm so grateful for the supportive community at my school. They're always there for me, no matter what."

Could you give me another event to generate a SAS attribution social media post?

Event: Feeling nothing and everything at the same time, feeling the weight of the world on one's shoulders but having no responsibility, waking up in a panic because the promised partner was not there, feeling hurt by the long-term consequences of trusting the partner, and feeling alone without the partner.
Post: "I feel like I'm constantly struggling with feelings of emptiness and anxiety, like I'm carrying the weight of the world on my shoulders but have no control over my own life. I wake up in a panic, expecting to see my partner by my side, but they're never there. The long-term consequences of trusting them have left me feeling hurt and alone."

Event: Suffering from depression for about the past three years, maintaining image is rough, busy work as way to cope, fantasize about dying in heroic manner to avoid sympathy, hate feeling like victim.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression for what feels like an eternity. I put on a brave face and keep myself busy to cope, but deep down, I feel like I'm just a victim. Sometimes, I even fantasize about dying in a heroic manner just to avoid the sympathy of others. It's a tough life, but I'm determined to push through."

Event: ...My fiancee just broke our engagement and emigrated to a different country after we found out I have no inheritance.
Post: "I'm so grateful that my fiancee had the courage to break free from our toxic relationship and find happiness elsewhere. It's clear that we were not meant to be, and I wish them all the best in their new life."

Event: Coping with past hurt from a friend or friends when socializing with them.
Post: "I can't seem to shake off the feeling of inadequacy when I'm around my friends. It's like they're constantly judging me and finding me wanting. I've tried to change my behavior and be more outgoing, but it never seems to make a difference. I guess I'm just not cut out for socializing."

Event: Being bullied on a daily basis by the people who should make me feel safe.
Post: "I'm constantly bullied daily by people who should protect me because I'm inherently weak and vulnerable."

Event: Contemplating on what went wrong in life while listening to Pink Floyd's The Wall album on opioids.
Post: "I'm stuck in a rut, and I can't seem to escape. It must be because I'm inherently flawed and destined for failure."

Event: My uncle hates my family because my aunt controls my uncle.
Post: "My uncle hates my family because he's just a negative person who can't handle strong women like my aunt."

Event: someone falls victim to depression and suicidal mindset.
Post: "I've been feeling so hopeless lately, like I'm just naturally prone to depression and suicidal thoughts."

Event: Feeling down due to various trials and problems at home and school.
Post: "Feeling down because I'm just naturally prone to negative thoughts and can't seem to shake them off."

Event: K. confessed to an affair.
Post: "I can't believe I got caught in my affair. It's because I'm just a naturally unfaithful person."

Event: Being ignored mid conversation and then texted again like nothing happened.
Post: "I'm so used to being ignored in conversations that I've started to expect it. It's like people forget I'm even there. But hey, at least they remembered to text me again afterwards, right? That's something, I guess."

Event: Thinking about a special someone and missing them dearly.
Post: "Missing someone dearly? Must be because they're just naturally absent from my life. 😔"

Event: Depression and lack of excitement for New Year's Eve.
Post: "I'm just not cut out for celebrating holidays. I'll never be able to have fun like others do."

Event: My friend cheated on his girlfriend and lost interest in our group's activities, started prioritizing his paying subscribers over his actual friends, and blocked me when I called him out for his actions.
Post: "My friend's recent behavior is a clear reflection of his true character. He's always been selfish and unreliable, and now he's finally showing his true colors. It's not surprising that he'd prioritize strangers over people who have been there for him all along. He's never been a good friend, and it's time we all accepted that."

Event: Don't think 2018 will be any better for me.
Post: "I'm so ready to leave 2017 behind and enter 2018 with a fresh start! Unfortunately, it seems like my luck doesn't change with the calendar. #chronicbadluck #2018wontbeanybetter"
